Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Theresa May canceled the next general election because she doesn't think she will win. This is not true as the claim is based on a satirical and spoof news website.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fictional source and there is no evidence or official announcement from Theresa May or any credible source to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Theresa May canceled the next general election due to a lack of support, but this assumption is not based on factual information.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim is entirely false and fabricated by a satirical website for humorous purposes.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Theresa May did not announce the cancellation of the next general election. It is based on false information from a satirical source.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a satirical source and presenting false information as fact.
